intro: Dorycnium pentaphyllum subsp. suffruticosum, commonly known as the creeping yellow trefoil, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring a creeping stem that forms dense mats. The plant has trifoliate leaves with three oval or lance-shaped leaflets, and it produces bright yellow flowers in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, woodland edges, and disturbed sites. Its botanical features make it an important plant for pollinators and a valuable species in ecological restoration projects.
